data.title: Association of Writers & Writing Programs
data.meta_description: AWP provides community, opportunities, ideas, news, and advocacy for writers and teachers of writing.
data.text:
July 1, 2024

Celebrate Disability Pride Month!

AWP recognizes July as Disability Pride Month and champions the importance of actively working toward a more inclusive and accessible global culture and environment. Disability comes in many ways, visible and invisible, internal and external, short-term and long-term. The AWP staff has compiled a list of resources, including past online events, articles from the Writer’s Chronicle, upcoming Disability Pride Month events, and informative resources on the history of disabilities and the Americans with Disabilities Act.

Read more...

June 12, 2024

Join AWP in Commemorating Juneteenth

Juneteenth is the momentous day in 1865 when news of the Emancipation Proclamation finally reached the last enslaved people in the United States, in Galveston, Texas—more than two years after the proclamation was issued. It is a time for celebration, reflection, and growth. We’ve assembled a collection of resources to commemorate Juneteenth and provide further education on its value and importance.

Read more...

June 3, 2024

Join AWP in Honoring Pride Month This June!

AWP has assembled a list of resources, including interactive and informative websites, author interviews, and other diverse programming. Check out the resources below to learn more about Pride Month and the LGBTQIA+ community, and pick up a new book from our Pride Month Reading List.

Read more...

May 28, 2024

AWP Executive Director to Retire, Successor Search Underway

Executive search firm Ballinger | Leafblad will lead a national search for Sherman’s successor.

Read more...

May 23, 2024

Virtual AWP: Writer to Writer Conversations & Readings with Mentor Kristen Witucki

We are thrilled to announce the premiere of our newest Virtual AWP conversation: “Writer to Writer Conversations and Readings with Mentor Kristen Witucki,” featuring mentees Sadia Kalam, Briana Maley, and Sarah Schiff! Tune in for a series of short readings and a discussion centering on the intersection of parenthood and writing.

Read more...
